questions.text: Vitamin A prophylaxis to a child is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Primary prevention Modes of Intervention: Health Promotion: Is targeted at strengthening the host through various approaches/ interventions, e.g., Health Education, Environmental modifications, Nutritional interventions, Lifestyle, and behavioral changes. Specific Protection: Targeting the prevention of disease through a specific intervention – Primary level of prevention is applied when ‘risk factors are present, but the disease has not yet taken place’ Ex: Vitamin A prophylaxis, Vaccines, Chemoprophylaxis

questions.text: Iron and folic acid supplementation forms:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Specific protection To avoid disease altogether is ideal, but this is possible only in a limited number of cases. Some currently available interventions aimed at specific protection are enumerated below: Immunization; Use of specific nutrients; Chemoprophylaxis; Protection against occupational hazards; Protection against accidents; Protection from carcinogens; Avoidance of allergens; Control of specific hazards in the general environment; and Control of consumer product quality and safety of food, drugs, etc.

questions.text: Action which halts the progress of the disease at its incipient stage and prevents complications:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Secondary prevention Level Phase of disease Objective Interventions Primordial Underlying conditions lead to causation Minimize hazards to health Inhibit the emergence of risk conditions Primary Specific causal factors Reduce incidence Personal and community efforts Secondary Early stages of the disease Shorten duration, Reduce the prevalence Early detection and prompt intervention Tertiary Late stages of the disease Reduce no./ impact of complications Lessen the effects of long-term disease/disability, minimize suffering

questions.text: Physiotherapy in polio is an example of :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tertiary prevention Tertiary Level of Prevention Is applied when a disease has advanced beyond early stages: It aims to reduce or limit impairments and disabilities, minimize suffering caused by existing departures from good health Modes of Intervention: Disability Limitation: It ‘prevents the transition of disease from impairment to handicap’ - Example: Physiotherapy in Poliomyelitis Rehabilitation: Training and retraining of an individual to the highest possible level of functional ability; it can be medical, vocational, social, or psychological Example: Crutches

questions.text: A 10-year-old child is not able to walk due to loss of foot is an example of :
questions.explanation:
Solution:
